ports.name: Update State Ports
ports.text: Updates the output-ports `Started` and `Progress`. This is handy to find out if the loop is playing, connect it e.g. to `MainLoop`. As this is not very performant, it is best to not connect this port when you don’t need access to `State` and `Progress`.

ports.name: Interval
ports.text: How often the event happens. See [Tone.js Time Docs](https://github.com/Tonejs/Tone.js/wiki/Time)

ports.name: Iterations
ports.text: How often the loop should be repeated. If set to `0` it will go on infinitely

ports.name: Playback Rate
ports.text: How fast the loop should be. `1` is default, `2` is double the speed and so on

ports.name: Humanize
ports.text: Adds a random variation to the scheduled time, so it is a bit more human (inprecise). If set `Humanize Time` will be used.

ports.name: Humanize Time
ports.text: If `Humanize` is set to true, a random variation to the scheduled time is added / subtracted, so it is a bit more human (inprecise)

ports.name: Probability
ports.text: The probably of the callback being invoked. `1` = all callbacks, `0` = no callbacks at all

ports.name: Start Time
ports.text: When along the timeline the loop should start. `0` means at the beginning

ports.name: Stop Time
ports.text: When along the timeline the loop should stop. `+0` means *right now*

ports.name: Cancel Time
ports.text: The time after which events will be cancel. `+0` means *right now*

ports.name: Cancel
ports.text: Cancel all scheduled events greater than or equal to the `Cancel Time`

ports.name: Trigger
ports.text: Triggers every time the loop has an event

ports.name: Started
ports.text: `true` when the loop is currently playing, `false` otherwise. For this value to update you need to connect `Update Stare Ports` e.g. to ´MainLoop´.

ports.name: Progress
ports.text: The current progress in the loop, `0` = *at the beginning*, `1` = *at the end*. For this value to update you need to connect `Update State Ports` e.g. to ´MainLoop´.
